page.title: 07THE LOCAL POPULATION
page.content: The number of people living in the survey area is approximately 250.There are three minor concentrations.One is at Bridge End on the eastern edge of the village of Great Bardfield.The others are at Hawkins Hill,Little Sampford and Hawkspur Green, a hamlet of Little Bardfield.The remainder are scattered throughout the area, living in isolated farmhouses or cottages. Many of the people are local farming families or people born in the area who work in neighbouring towns or villages.Others are retired people who wished to settle in the countryside or commuters who are prepared to accept the travel commitment to London, Cambridge or Chelmsford as the price for living in the heart of the Essex countryside.Examples of the kind of work these people do are teaching, legal, carpentry and secretarial.
